content.pattern_trigger: Determining the time required to complete a task given a constant daily rate.
content.strategy_solution: Time_required = Total_work / Daily_rate. Ensure the units for work and rate are compatible.

content.pattern_trigger: Finding the number of students who scored a certain grade threshold when given a percentage below that threshold.
content.strategy_solution: 1. Calculate the percentage of students above the threshold as: Above_Percentage = 100% - Below_Percentage. 2. Calculate the number of students above the threshold as: Number_Above = Total_Students * (Above_Percentage / 100).

content.pattern_trigger: Determining total savings from multiple items with individual discounts.
content.strategy_solution: 1. Calculate the discount per item: Discount_Per_Item = Original_Price - Discounted_Price. 2. Calculate the total discount for the quantity purchased: Total_Discount = Discount_Per_Item * Quantity. 3. Sum the total discounts for all items: Total_Savings = Sum(Total_Discount for each item).

content.pattern_trigger: Calculating the combined total frequency of events occurring at different rates over a period of time.
content.strategy_solution: 1. Determine the frequency (F) of each event per unit time (T). 2. Calculate the combined frequency per unit time: Combined_Frequency = F1 + F2 + F3. 3. Multiply the combined frequency by the time period (P): Total_Frequency = Combined_Frequency * P.

content.pattern_trigger: Determining the additional monthly payment for a shorter repayment period.
content.strategy_solution: 1. Calculate the monthly payment for the longer repayment period: \( \text{Monthly\_Payment}_{\text{Long}} = \frac{\text{Total\_Loan}}{\text{Months}_{\text{Long}}}\). 2. Calculate the monthly payment for the shorter repayment period: \( \text{Monthly\_Payment}_{\text{Short}} = \frac{\text{Total\_Loan}}{\text{Months}_{\text{Short}}}\). 3. Find the difference in monthly payments: \( \text{Additional\_Monthly\_Payment} = \text{Monthly\_Payment}_{\text{Short}} - \text{Monthly\_Payment}_{\text{Long}}\).

content.pattern_trigger: Determining the number of attendees when given the total capacity, fraction of unoccupied seats, and seat capacity.
content.strategy_solution: 1. Calculate Total_Capacity = Number_of_Chairs * Seat_Capacity. 2. Calculate Unoccupied_Chairs = Number_of_Chairs * Unoccupied_Fraction. 3. Calculate Unoccupied_Seats = Unoccupied_Chairs * Seat_Capacity. 4. Calculate Attendees = Total_Capacity - Unoccupied_Seats.

content.pattern_trigger: Calculating the remaining number of birds after a certain period given a constant daily loss.
content.strategy_solution: 1. Calculate the total number of birds initially: \( \text{Total\_Birds\_Initial} = \text{Chickens\_Initial} + \text{Turkeys\_Initial} + \text{Guinea\_Fowls\_Initial} \) 2. Determine the total number of birds lost per day: \( \text{Total\_Birds\_Lost\_Per\_Day} = \text{Chickens\_Lost\_Per\_Day} + \text{Turkeys\_Lost\_Per\_Day} + \text{Guinea\_Fowls\_Lost\_Per\_Day} \) 3. Calculate the total number of birds lost in the given period: \( \text{Total\_Birds\_Lost\_In\_Period} = \text{Total\_Birds\_Lost\_Per\_Day} \times \text{Number\_Of\_Days} \) 4. Calculate the remaining number of birds: \( \text{Remaining\_Birds} = \text{Total\_Birds\_Initial} - \text{Total\_Birds\_Lost\_In

content.pattern_trigger: Determining the remaining distance to be covered on the last day of a trip.
content.strategy_solution: 1. Calculate the total distance covered in the known days: Distance_known_days = Distance_per_day * Number_of_known_days. 2. Calculate the remaining distance to be covered: Remaining_distance = Total_trip_distance - Distance_known_days. 3. The distance to be covered on the last day: Distance_last_day = Remaining_distance.

content.pattern_trigger: Calculating total time spent watching TV given the duration of different shows and the number of episodes.
content.strategy_solution: Total_Time = (Number_of_Jeopardy_episodes * Duration_of_Jeopardy) + (Number_of_Wheel_of_Fortune_episodes * Duration_of_Wheel_of_Fortune). Convert the total time from minutes to hours by dividing by 60.

content.pattern_trigger: Calculating earnings based on time worked and hourly rate.
content.strategy_solution: Earnings = (Time_Worked_Minutes / 60) * Hourly_Rate. Ensure time is converted to hours before calculating.

content.pattern_trigger: Distributing a total number of items among a group and then calculating the number of items in each container.
content.strategy_solution: Let \( T \) be the total number of pencils, \( F \) be the number of friends, \( P \) be the number of pencils each friend gets, \( K \) be the number of boxes, and \( X \) be the number of pencils in each box. The steps are: 1. Calculate the total number of pencils shared among friends: \( F \times P \). 2. Add the pencils Arnel kept: \( T = (F \times P) + \text{pencils kept} \). 3. Solve for the number of pencils in each box: \( X = \frac{T}{K} \).

content.pattern_trigger: Determining the number of tasks completed given total earnings and earnings per task.
content.strategy_solution: 1. Calculate Total_Earnings = Allowance + Earnings_from_Lawns. 2. Calculate Remaining_Earnings = Total_Savings - Total_Earnings. 3. Calculate Number_of_Driveways = Remaining_Earnings / Earnings_per_Driveway.
